lexUnit.name: fascinate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: irresistibly attract the interest of.

sentence.text: It so fascinated me that I stopped in the middle of the subway .
THE AMAZING LENGTHS to which parent animals will go to protect their young has fascinated animal-watchers for centuries .
And it has fascinated Bill Foggitt for most of his 79 years .
It was just this power and seriousness that had fascinated her in the first place .
As the spacesuit folded in on itself like one of the Transformers toys that had fascinated the boys in Ace 's school for a brief season , Defries joined her at the window .
After graduating , Morgan spent some time amongst the Iroquois Indians , who had fascinated him since his college days , and published his famous League of the Iroquois in 1851 .
Symmetry never ceases to fascinate the human being .
So the hedges which most interest the historian are those which most fascinate the botanist .
It fascinated her , the way that Jessica called her father ` daddy " , in the Irish fashion .
But the smoke plumes fascinated her .
She might now resent being asked to rush to the aid of her rival , the exotic white-skinned educated foreigner who so fascinated her husband .
But she was fascinated by their names : Cadge , Perks , Wily , Quarrell .
Historians have always been fascinated by the decline of political parties .
Quite a number confessed that they had never asked themselves that question and were fascinated by having to analyse their decision to farm .
I was fascinated by our shiny mahogany Sobell wireless set as a kid , and would wait hours for Dick Barton to emerge from the back .
But the patients are always fascinated by the colours .
I 've always been fascinated by other cultures , traditions and people , particularly those removed from the Western World .
Ruth was fascinated by the charterhouse where Chopin had composed his ` Funeral March " .
Rosemarie Mitchell 's been fascinated by dinosaurs since the age of 5 .
Since the dawning of history , people have been fascinated , intoxicated and mystified by the powers of aromatic plants .
The friar was fascinated .
It did n't matter , he was fascinated .
A new book ( to be published in July by HMSO ) written by Mrs Olive M Geddes of the Library 's Manuscripts Division will fascinate anyone who is curious about the early history of golf .
Whatever its size , it is this trapped space that has fascinated both artists and scientists .
Optics have fascinated Dall since he bought a spyglass telescope from a market stall in his mid-teens .
Dialect words fascinated him and footnotes were often added to help the reader on derivations of place-names and other unusual words .
Invalided out of the army in 1915 , Colman began to take up the acting career which had fascinated him since amateur dramatics in childhood .
Fossils fascinate him too , and he says that he might even look to a career in palaeontology .
` It fascinated him more than anything else .
Iain Logan had been listening to him as though fascinated by the stress of experience which had lengthened Cameron 's face and closed his black brows over his eyes .
Why is she fascinated by a style perfected under a dictator whose crimes the Soviet people are just beginning to understand ?
The spectacle of extreme cruelty appals , it also fascinates , it may obscure the sin , which then acquires the dignity of a mystery .
It fascinates , enthralls , amazes , and delights .
